titles.title: Welfare Elimination Act of 1994

To establish a commission to design a plan for transition from certain welfare, job training, and child care programs to new programs providing temporary financial aid and assistance in locating permanent employment.

bill.summary: 1/26/1994--Introduced. Welfare Elimination Act of 1994 - Establishes the Commission to Eliminate Welfare. Directs the Commission to design and report to the Congress a plan for transition from certain welfare, child care, food stamps, job training, and targeted jobs tax credit programs to specified new programs and to specified new programs providing temporary financial aid and assistance in locating permanent employment.
